summary:
The caper bush is a special plant that grows in the Mediterranean region. It has pretty white and pink flowers and tasty parts that people eat! The flower buds, called capers, and the fruits, known as caper berries, are often pickled or salted and used to flavor food.

Scientists aren't sure if it's one type of plant or many similar ones. It's a bit of a mystery where it originally came from, but it's now a well-known ingredient in many cuisines.
title: Caper
